body:
It's not said explicitly, but:

> A field or method f of an anonymous field in a struct x is called promoted if x.f is a legal selector that denotes that field or method f. ([src](https://tip.golang.org/ref/spec#Struct_types))

I think the above effectively equals saying that promoted fields/methods are anonymous fields/methods of anonymous fields which can be accessed using a selector that omits the anonymous field name because the selector is unambiguous.
